snippet: After years of swinging a hammer, Michael Bilello was elected as the leader of the city’s 25,000 unionized carpenters, and pledged to return democracy and integrity to a union in distress.
abstract: Michael Bilello, elected leader of the the New York City District Council of Carpenters in December, has his work cut out for him; among the challenges he faces are an increase in nonunion construction in the city, unsigned labor contracts and organized-crime families that still view the Council of Carpenters as a prime feeding ground.
lead_paragraph: After years of swinging a hammer, Michael Bilello was elected as the leader of the city’s 25,000 unionized carpenters, and pledged to return democracy and integrity to a union in distress.

headline.seo: New Face, Lingering Problems for New York City’s Carpenters’ Union
headline.main: Laying Down His Hammer to Apply a Broom to a Troubled Union
headline.print_headline: Laying Down His Hammer to Apply a Broom to a Troubled Union
